jade.path
Class AStar

java.lang.Object
  jade.path.Path
      jade.path.GraphSearch
          jade.path.AStar

public class AStar
extends GraphSearch

Uses the A* algorithm to quickly find optimal paths. So long as the heuristic is admissible, meaning it never overestimates, the returned path is guaranteed to be an optimal path. The closer to the actual cost the heuristic is, the faster A* will run. A* is aloways complete.

Method Detail

gCost

protected double gCost(World world,
                       Coord start,
                       Coord end)
Description copied from class: GraphSearch
Calculates the cost of going from start to end. This method should only be called with there is a valid transition from start to end, so normally start and end will be adjacent tiles.

Specified by:
gCost in class GraphSearch
Parameters:
world - the world on which the cost is being calculated
start - the start of transition
end - the endof transition
Returns:
the cacluated cost from end to start

hEstimate

protected double hEstimate(World world,
                           Coord start,
                           Coord end)
Description copied from class: GraphSearch
Estimates the cost of going from start to end, without actually calculating the cost. This heurstic can be used to inform searches and reduce the run time. Some algorithms, such as A*, can be guaranteed to yield optimal results so long as the heuristic is admissible, meaning it will never overestimate the true cost.

Specified by:
hEstimate in class GraphSearch
Parameters:
world - the world on which the cost is being estimated
start - the start of the estimated path cost
end - the end of the estimated path cost
Returns:
the heurstic estimate of the cost from end to start
